cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles SSW of Freeport, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to slow, then turn north and northeast while hugging the upper Texas coast toward southeast Texas and southwestern Louisiana.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Matagorda Peninsula/Port O’Connor, TX coast

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA (Tropical Storm); Port Aransas, TX to Sabine Pass, TX including Galveston Bay (Storm Surge)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central and Upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay, extending into southwestern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 40–50 mph with higher gusts) are expected; 99 % probability of 34-kt winds, up to 6 % chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible in Galveston Bay and adjacent coastal areas.
weather_observation.rainfall: Totals of 5–10 in with isolated 15 in possible, creating flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents impacting port operations.
